briefdescription.para: Invalidates the vertices, edges and faces.
Invalidates the color of each vertex.
Invalidate the normal of each vertex.
Invalidate everything.
The Gl_data_name enum is used as a flag to specify what should be re-computed during computeElements().

detaileddescription.para: The flag corresponding to this enum is Gl_data_names, and multiple flags can be combined whith the operator |. For instance, you can use GEOMETRY|COLORS as a single value.

briefdescription.para: Flag interface for Scene_item::Gl_data_name.
Flag interface for Scene_item::Gl_data_name.
processData calls computeElements()
setAlpha sets the integer value of the alpha channel of this item.

detaileddescription.para:
Also updates the slider value. It must be between 0 and 255.
alpha
the integer value for the alpha channel.

briefdescription.para: The item's bounding box.

detaileddescription.para:
If the Bbox has never been computed, computes it and saves the result for further calls.
the item's bounding box.

briefdescription.para: getTriangleContainer returns the idth Triangle_container.
getEdgeContainer returns the idth Edge_container.
getPointContainer returns the idth Point_container.
setTriangleContainer sets the idth Triangle_container to tc.

detaileddescription.para: If id is bigger than the current size of the container vector, this vector is resized accordingly. This means that for optimisation reasons, containers should be created decreasingly.

briefdescription.para: setEdgeContainer sets the idth Edge_container to tc.

detaileddescription.para: If id is bigger than the current size of the container vector, this vector is resized accordingly. This means that for optimisation reasons, containers should be created decreasingly.

briefdescription.para: setPointContainer sets the idth Point_container to tc.

detaileddescription.para: If id is bigger than the current size of the container vector, this vector is resized accordingly. This means that for optimisation reasons, containers should be created decreasingly.

briefdescription.para: setBuffersFilled specifies if the data should be re-computed.

detaileddescription.para: If called with false, the item rendering data will be re-computed at the next draw(). If called with true, the item rendering data is considered ready and will not be computed until setBuffersFilled() is called with false again.

briefdescription.para: getBuffersFilled returns false if the item rendering data needs to be re-computed., true otherwise.
getBuffersInit returns true if the Vaos of viewer are ready for rendering.
setBuffersInit specifies if the Vbos need to be initialized.

detaileddescription.para: If called with false, the item Vbos will be refilled at the next draw(). If called with true, the item Vbos are considered ready and will not be refilled until setBuffersInit() is called with false again.
This function should be called in the drawing functions, when getBuffersFilled() is true.

briefdescription.para: the item's bounding box's diagonal length.

detaileddescription.para:
If the diagonal's length has never been computed, computes it and saves the result for further calls.
the item's bounding box's diagonal length.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the slider initialized in initGL();.
Returnstrue if initGL() was called.
Returns the float alpha value of an item.
Fills the Vbos with data.
Creates the VAOs and VBOs for each existing viewer.
Computes the items Bbox and stores the result.
setBbox allows to set the Bbox in compute_bbox();
The Scene_item_rendering_helper class is a convenience class for constructing an item.

detaileddescription.para: It is more elaborated than a Scene_item and facilitates the process of creating an item that can be rendered.
